name: Corfu Mare Boutique Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an extremely solid hotel with a big swimming pool set nicely on the edge of town. However, no way would you call it stylish. It is excellent in many respects - breakfast is plentiful and the hotel itself is very clean. Linen is good and fresh and bathrooms are also very good with plenty of good toiletries. Excellent shower. Staff here are very friendly and could not be more helpful.
reviews.title: Substance over style

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The position contrary to what previous writers have said is actually a 30-40 minute walk into town. Public transport is available but not late evening as buses stop early. The walk into town is not great being through a rather boring built up area or along a busy coastal road - a dual carriageway. A hire car is pretty much a necessity. More than ample parking.
reviews.title: Friendly small hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Corfu Town is delightful from October to May but must be overrun in the high season. Restaurants`are generally of a high standard and the cafe scene is unrivalled and a huge attraction. The old town is absolutely delightful with a real Italianate feel.
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Driving out into the countryside in October is a treat as long as you head north or west from Corfu Town. The north is generally very hilly and extremely green at this time of the year - very lush. This is Greece. However what we saw of the south of the island especially around Benitses is absolutely horrendous with potholed busy roads, rocky tiny beaches and grotty scenery. Maybe it gets a bit better further south but we saw no evidence of that. Paleokastritses at this time of year is beautiful and well worth the effort. The north east is the better bet once you have got clear of the Corfu Town hinterland.
reviews.title: Great hotel, ok location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all we had a lovely time but would never come during the season. The signs are that it would be a pretty horrendous place.
reviews.title: A very pleasant stay

description: Corfu Mare Boutique Hotel has 48 rooms, 2 master suites and 1 junior suite, 500m away from the port, 1,5Km from Corfu Town and 2Km from the airport. The well balanced ambiance combines the exceptional elegance of the Venetian architecture with the serenity of the green-blue shades of the Corfiot landscape. In the garden there is a pool with an incorporated Jacuzzi and inside the hotel offers a bar, a relaxing lounge area and a welcoming lobby all featuring contemporary decor and furnishings.
